creator: david.konecny@volny.cz
text:
In NetBeans project we are generating Java help from your Ant documentation and
because the NetBeans IDE is "accessible" (can be used by disabled people) the
help pages must be accessible as well. To make help files accessible means that
screen-readers which disabled people uses are capable to read page for the user.
In practice it means:
* all images must have <alt> tag
* all tables must have <th> tag and scope attribute must be set to "col"
* there should not be any hardcoded colors so that color-blind people can use
their own CSS

We are doing changes like this after each major Ant release. I'm attaching diff
with all the changes. It is up to you to consider to apply these changes. It
does not change documentation visually (apart from two details -
antexternal.html and optionalTasks/setproxy.html were modified to do not use
tables) and gives you something what you can use/need in future. For us it will
be of course easier in future if you accept the patch, because we will have less
work.

I'm just submitting the patch. Actual work was done by
<john.jullion-ceccarelli@sun.com>. The patch was generated against the
ANT_151_FINAL branch.

Thank you for considering this.

I encourage you to get involved in the xdocs sub-project.  Run 'ant docs-from-scratch' (with 256M VM size) in the proposal/xdocs directory from Ant's CVS.  Look in the build/gen and build/docs directory to see the results.Rather than patching Ant's current documentation, get on board with the way it should work in the future.  I look forward to your help in generating the views, or at least your feedback in the information captured.  I think NetBeans could benefit dramatically from this "descriptor" information of Ant's tasks, not just for accessibility of the documentation, but for build.xml editing.
creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com

text:
Thanx for the info Eric. Will this system be already used in next release of
Ant? If yes, then this issue does not make any sense and can be closed as WONTFIX.

I'm going to forward your email to our documentation writer. It is up to them.

"I think NetBeans could benefit dramatically from this descriptor information of
Ant's tasks, not just for accessibility of the documentation, but for build.xml
editing." - what do you mean by "build.xml editing"?
creator: david.konecny@volny.cz
jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text:
I do not know if the xdocs proposal will be in the next version of Ant yet.  That all depends on the amount of time I can devote to this project and when that elusive "next version" will be released.  Both of those are big unknowns at this point.

As for "editing build.xml" - NetBeans has a builtin build file editor mode such that you have property inspector boxes for each task, targets, and the project.  Wouldn't NetBeans benefit from precisely accurate information about each task such that those property inspectors can use that metadata to constrain booleans to checkboxes, drop-downs for EnumeratedAttributes, etc?  I bet it would!   Currently, I presume, someone has hardcoded that stuff somewhere, right?
Sure, now I see what you meant.
